CS102, Spring 2015| Klukowska                         CSCI 102 sec. 1, 2: Data Structures, Spring 2015                Home       Syllabus       Daily       Resources                          "I will, in fact, claim that the difference between a bad programmer and a good     one is whether he considers his code or his data structures more important.     Bad programmers worry about the code. Good programmers worry about data structures     and their relationships."       Linus Torvalds, 2006             Joanna Klukowska    Clinical Assistant Professor,    Computer Science Department,    Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences,    New York University     Email address           Mailing address    Warren Weaver Hall, Room 423    251 Mercer Street    New York, NY 10012       Office hours    Mondays 12:30 - 1:30PM    Thursdays 11:00AM - 1:00PM    (or by appointment)          Current courses        CSCI 101 sec. 1, 2        CSCI 102 sec. 1, 2        CSCI 201 sec. 3                    Tweets by @joannakl_nyu                         Course Essentials                Class meetings: Mondays and Wednesdays: 11:00am-12:15pm         (attendance is mandatory).     Recitations: Mondays: 3:30-4:45pm     (attendance is mandatory).     Recitation Leader: Paul Gazzillo        Tutors:       Monday:      5-8pm Xavier @ 412WWH    Tuesday:      10-12 Jenny @ 412WWH      5-8pm Xavier @ 412WWH    Wednesday:      5-7pm Jenny @ 412WWH      7-9pm Xavier @ 412WWH    Thursday:      1-3pm Xavier @ 14 Washington Pl. Lab      5-7pm Jenny @ 412WWH    Friday:      3-5pm Xavier @ 412WWH    Any changes from the regular schedule are reflected on the weekly schedule at        http://cs.nyu.edu/~joannakl/cs102TutorSchedule.html               Office hours:     Joanna: Mondays 12:30-1:30pm, Thursdays 11:00am-1:00pm (423 WWH).     Paul: Mondays 9:50-10:50am, 2:15-3:15pm (704 715BWY).         Class discussion board: piazza.com/nyu/spring2015/csci10212 - all questions related to course material and homeworks should     be posted to the forums. You should send email only if it involves personal content (for example, your grades, performance, etc.)        How to get help?    Ask questions on discussion forums (Piazza)! Ask questions in recitations and during lectures!   Talk to me! Email me! See your recitation leader, tutors or myself during office hours!    Make sure you let me know as soon as you feel lost in the course. Do not wait till you    start getting failing grades because it might be too late by then.            Catalog Description         Data Structures    CSCI-UA 102 Prerequisite: Introduction to Computer Science (CSCI-UA 101).    NOTE: The prerequisite means that you DO NEED TO KNOW AND REMEMBER the material from CSCI-UA 101.    Offered in the fall and spring. 4 points.    Use and design of data structures, which organize information in    computer memory. Stacks, queues, linked lists, binary trees:    how to implement them in a high-level language, how to analyze their    effect on algorithm efficiency, and how to modify them.    Programming assignments.               Important Dates         Wednesday, March 25 (in class) : Midterm Exam      Monday, May 18, 10:00-11:50am, Final Exam (date and time subject to change by CAS)                         Department Links         Computer Science Department     Faculty Office Hours     Statement of Academic Integrity
